subject: Re: [junit] Question about JUnit 4 execution
msgSnippet: Hi, if I may rewrite my question, when I run this Test class, how many instances of this class are created and runned ?! -- Thx, Milan. ... From: Lasse
messageBody:
Hi,

if I may rewrite my question, when I run this "Test" class, how many instances of this class are created and runned ?!

--
Thx, Milan.

----- Original Message ----
From: Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, February 3, 2008 12:28:29 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] Question about JUnit 4 execution














Hi,



On Jan 28, 2008 4:37 PM, milanmilanovich <milanmilanovich@ yahoo.com> wrote:

> public class Test {

> public static MyClass ins;

> @BeforeClass

> public static void beforeAllMethod( ) {

> ins = new MyClass();

> // Is this "ins" object available in all @Test methods in the class?

> }

> }

>

> My question is related to the static "ins" object, is this object

> unique to this Class and its @Test methods during JUnit test of this

> test class ?



I'm not sure what you mean by "unique to this class" but the static

field initialized by a @BeforeClass method is accessible by all

instances of the test class and therefore by all @Test methods.



Lasse
